summary: "Rebecca" is a popular Gothic novel written by Daphne du Maurier in 1938. It tells the story of a young woman who marries a rich widower, only to find his home and family still obsessed with his late first wife, Rebecca. The book was a huge success and has been made into movies and plays many times, including a famous film by Alfred Hitchcock. The character Mrs. Danvers and the estate Manderley are especially memorable. The story starts with the famous line: "Last night, I dreamt I went to Manderley again."
title: Rebecca (novel)
